body: you can remove pimple. â it's in 3rdparty now finally.â

ok, i had to say this but i don't really like the idea of having a multi-select in group admin. its superb for selecting multiple groups for a user but not for selecting group admin. since we have a whole sidebar of groups and users are displayed according to groups.

lets take a test case : 

i am assuming that if a user is group admin of a particular group he has to be a part of it, at least, so when i am in say "group1" i should only have the option of promoting the user of that very group to its admin. a checkbox is enough to do that imo.
why should i be making a user group admin of "group2" from the "group1" list when i don't know he is in "group1" or not? it simply doesn't make sense.

the concept is fine in master as there is no group filter but in my branch, there is a filter already. so just tweaking a checkbox is enough to promote a user to a group admin for that particular group.

another negative of this is when i added a group sidebar and avatars. they take a decent amount of space from the left which makes having 2 multiselects on the right very very cluttered. its so cluttered that i cant see more than 2 groups in the multiselect title(for users who are a part of more than 4-5 groups is horrible.)

what hat i suggest is to get a button / checkbox in front of a user so that he can be promoted to the admin of that particular group. also it adds a class that gives that row a slight highlight.

 what do you guys think? i can give mockups of this looks bad, i have tried it tested it. :\ cc @jancborchardt @raydiation @kondou-ger @kabum @owncloud/designers

agreeing with raghu here: it makes absolutely no sense imo to have a seperate filter for all group admins. if you want to see all group admins of group x click on the group x entry. the group admins are sorted up and maybe colored distinguishable to see them at a glance.

another thing that i dislike is having the add group at the bottom of the left list. dont we have a convention (notes, news, contacts, etc) to have the plus button to add stuff at the very top? same goes for adding users: the first entry in the user list should contain the form elements to add another user. that way we can get rid of that horribly awkward top bar and only use it for filtering.

@raghunayyar so letâ€™s say every user only has a checkbox for being group admin. 2 big questions arise:
1. how do i manage group admins in the â»everyoneâ« view?
2. how do i see which groups this person is group admin of?
on top of that, having the checkbox left of the user is like the files selection of multiple elements â€“ which it isnâ€™t in this case, hence confusing.

having the same multiselect for selecting group admins was an informed decision based on the use cases, please donâ€™t just remove it. space is not really an issue because we can always ellipsize or size constrain what is shown of the group dropdown.

the user row should be exactly the same whichever group i am in. the multiselect for groups also shows all groups: i can add the user to group2 while iâ€™m in the view for group1, so it should be possible to also make them group admin of any group from any view. when making a user group admin of a group they are not part of yet, they should be added to it automatically as a member as well.

@raydiation i think you misunderstand @raghunayyarâ€™s question there. he wasnâ€™t asking about a filter for group admins (in the left sidebar), but about the multiselect in the user row for selecting which groups this user is admin for.
i do agree with your other points though:
* â»new groupâ« (please rename it from â»add groupâ«) should be at the top of the left list (or rather below the fixed groups â»everyoneâ«, â»adminsâ« etc.) â€“ didnâ€™t know you changed that @raghunayyar?
* â»new userâ« should also be at the very top of the list. the whole row should be clickable to reveal the input fields, the input fields should not be visible at all times. and it should not be a fixed top bar, but rather scroll with the content. @raghunayyar as we talked about in berlin.

@raghunayyar hope that makes it clear. if not letâ€™s have a call about it, thatâ€™s better than typing here.
rebase please

```
 ldap and password retrieval : the php part i am completely unaware of, @blizzz some help here, please? 
```

ldap passwords cannot be retrieved nor changed.

i had a short look at it and want to provide some feedback:

- i can't create a new user
```php notice:  undefined index: username in /home/src/owncloud/web/oc/settings/ajax/createuser.php on line 26, referer: http://localhost/oc/index.php/settings/users```

- can't change password, ajax call returns ```{"data":{"message":"unable to change password"},"status":"error"}```

- usability issue: to change the password i have to leave the input field, pressing "enter" doesn't execute the password change

- in master i created two users "admin" and "user2" after switching to your branch i only see the user "admin", "user2" is gone.

- search doesn't work, if i start enter a username nothing happens, no visual feedback, no ajax calls in the js console

- clicking on "everyone" on the left side bar doesn't show any user, the user "admin" is only visible if i choose "admins"

- the reasons why i had a look at it in the first place: i wanted to have a look at the recovery key integration. unfortunately i can't see any possibility to enter the recovery key to change passwords if the encryption app is enabled and the recovery key is set.

together with the open tasks mentioned above by @raghunayyar and the given timetable for oc6 i wonder if we will get this ready in time, raghu what's your estimation?

edit: should have read your great blog post first, than i would have known that the plan is to finish it by the end of the week and that you are already aware of the search issue...
@raghunayyar rebase is necessary - thx
yes, rebase please. i think there is a fix in the oc user management that touches ldap (as we have seen on dev sprint). otherwise i cannot test with ldap properly.
@deepdiver1975 @blizzz sorry for the delay, doing it. :)
okay, i hope the rebase came of fine. damn scared.

i was thinking about rebasing on master. nevertheless, i merged locally for testing.
- no user shown when clicking on "everyone" (should be around 40)
- no user shown when clicking on "admins" (at least 2)
- in one ldap group it is indicated that 3 users are there, but only two are shown.
- in another one, 10 are indicated (should be around 30), only 3 are shown.
- password field can be typed in, but not changed (both local and ldap. first one should work, for letter one it should not be offered, it's detectable on a per user basis whether password can be changed or not). neither by pressing enter nor by clicking out of the input field (no ajax request)
- quota cannot be changed (no ajax request)
- it looks like local groups can be added to any user (correct behaviour), but it also does not happen (not even with page  refresh)
- did not i see at the sprint that you were working on a user search/filter field? now i don't see it there.

i tried with firefox 23, no js errors were shown. also nothing suspicious in the error log. some of the points  above may have to do with changes in oc user/group management (php) in oc 6, as it got restructured. i can help validating php stuff of course.

don't let the list discourage you, just want to give a complete overview of what i found. the refurbishment of the users page is more than appreciated :)

the list of users goes off with me fixing the routes. i am currently on it already. everyone, don't get displayed is a known issue. search works just fine, (let me fix the routes and you can confirm. :)) default quota can be changed, please confirm. user quota can't at the moment. all the group addition and toggling depends on multiselect, which is currently eating up my maximum time.
don't let the list discourage you, just want to give a complete overview of what i found. the refurbishment of the users page is more than appreciated :)
i know, its a core feature, it should be fool proof before going in. the php written already wasn't tested as well, afaik. so i am sure we will need some tests for that.
@blizzz i reverted my initial commit which was fixing a few route errors, you can test the search now. i will push it again when the error gets completely fixed.

â»new groupâ« (please rename it from â»add groupâ«) should be at the top of the left list (or rather below the fixed groups â»everyoneâ«, â»adminsâ« etc.) â€“ didnâ€™t know you changed that @raghunayyar?
@jancborchardt : it is below everyone and admins. it should be on top of everything, like in the news, notes app or rather wherever the left sidebar is used imo. about the input fields for user creation, i remember. i will do that. animations have to be done. :)

the problems with the group filters still exists, no change here. well apart from that the group with 3 users shows zero users, now ;)

i still don't see a search field :(

also adding users or groups still does not trigger an ajax call. so, actually it behaves like reported before.
this is very weird as it is working fine with me. i will check again.

@raghunayyar your rebase 4 days ago didn't really do anything

once you pulled in the current state into master branch you need to merge master into your branch
````
git checkout master
git pull
git checkout soc-user2
git merge master
````
@deepdiver1975 no merge please. git rebase master should be enough

> no merge please. git rebase master should be enough

ok - teach me: what's the background on this? merge just worked out fine in the past - thx

it's putting all your commits on top of master, which changes history which is ok on a feature branch (requires force to commit). merging master however puts master on top of your work again. works too, of course.

the "new group" interaction element should be on top of the user-created
groups (like it is now) much like it is on top of the user-created
playlists in music. that way when clicked, the new group/playlist can show
up directly below it. do not put it on the very top above the fixed groups
(like "everyone" and "favorites") for the sake of it being on the very top.

cc @raghunayyar @kabum
